docs.abstract: The decision by the United States International Trade Commission is a win for small- and medium-size newspapers, which have struggled to absorb higher newsprint costs.
docs.snippet: The decision by the United States International Trade Commission is a win for small- and medium-size newspapers, which have struggled to absorb higher newsprint costs.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States International Trade Commission on Wednesday overturned a Trump administration decision to impose tariffs on Canadian newsprint, saying that American paper producers are not harmed by newsprint imports.

headline.main: Trump’s Tariffs on Canadian Newsprint Are Overturned
headline.print_headline: Tariffs on Paper Imports Are Overturned by Panel

byline.original: By Catie Edmondson and Alan Rappeport

docs.abstract: The Seattle City Council repealed the tax in a 7-to-2 vote that was accompanied by acrimony and accusations. Less than a month ago, it had passed unanimously.
docs.snippet: The Seattle City Council repealed the tax in a 7-to-2 vote that was accompanied by acrimony and accusations. Less than a month ago, it had passed unanimously.
docs.lead_paragraph: Seattle officials scuttled a corporate tax on Tuesday that they had wholeheartedly endorsed just a month ago, delivering a win for the measure’s biggest opponent — Amazon — and offering a warning to cities bidding for the retailer’s second headquarters that the company would go to the limit to get its way.

headline.main: Seattle Officials Repeal Tax That Upset Amazon
headline.print_headline: Amazon Played Hardball on New Tax. Now Seattle Is Killing the Tax.

byline.original: By David Streitfeld and Claire Ballentine

docs.abstract: Operatives used cryptocurrency to obscure their identities and pay for the infrastructure needed to steal emails from Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign.
docs.snippet: Operatives used cryptocurrency to obscure their identities and pay for the infrastructure needed to steal emails from Hillary Clinton’s 2016 presidential campaign.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — In early 2016, Russian intelligence officers obtained a new pool of the virtual currency Bitcoin. They quickly put the digital money to work.

headline.main: How Russian Spies Hid Behind Bitcoin in Hacking Campaign
headline.print_headline: Cryptocurrency Was Cloak  For Agents to Hide Behind

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Russian Interference in 2016 US Elections and Ties to Trump Associates

byline.original: By Nathaniel Popper and Matthew Rosenberg

docs.abstract: The city’s regulators have a message for freewheeling scooter start-ups: Those that “ask forgiveness, not permission,” will not be forgiven.
docs.snippet: The city’s regulators have a message for freewheeling scooter start-ups: Those that “ask forgiveness, not permission,” will not be forgiven.
docs.lead_paragraph: Regulators in San Francisco have a message for freewheeling scooter start-ups: Those that “ask forgiveness, not permission,” will not be forgiven.

headline.main: San Francisco Grants 2 Scooter Permits (but Not to the Early Disrupters)
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Rejects Deals For Scooters To Disrupters

docs.abstract: The actor just made her second start-up investment, in dating app Bumble. Her investments will skew heavily toward companies with an element of social impact, and companies founded by women.
docs.snippet: The actor just made her second start-up investment, in dating app Bumble. Her investments will skew heavily toward companies with an element of social impact, and companies founded by women.
docs.lead_paragraph: In one of her first acts as a start-up investor, the actor Priyanka Chopra recently toured the San Francisco home of her new portfolio company, a coding education company called Holberton School.

headline.main: Priyanka Chopra Is a Tech Investor, Too
headline.print_headline: An Actor Teamed Up With an Angel to Divine Tech Investments Together

docs.abstract: Tech shares helped drive stocks up in the United States on Thursday, helping make up ground a day after the S. & P. 500 dropped 3 percent to fall into negative territory for the year.
docs.snippet: Tech shares helped drive stocks up in the United States on Thursday, helping make up ground a day after the S. & P. 500 dropped 3 percent to fall into negative territory for the year.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stocks rebounded on Thursday as strong earnings from major tech companies seemed to ease some of the worries driving a recent wave of selling that had wiped out the market’s gains for the year.

headline.main: Stocks Climb, Recovering From a Decline That Wiped Out 2018’s Gains
headline.print_headline: Tech Earnings Help Markets Rebound From Sell-Off

byline.original: By Matt Phillips and Amie Tsang

docs.abstract: The British sandwich chain was criticized for inadequate labeling after a 15-year-old girl died after eating one of its sandwiches.
docs.snippet: The British sandwich chain was criticized for inadequate labeling after a 15-year-old girl died after eating one of its sandwiches.
docs.lead_paragraph: Pret A Manger, the British sandwich chain that has become a mainstay of office lunches with the promise of freshly prepared food, will be adding information about allergens in its food after the death of a girl who ate a sandwich containing sesame seeds, an ingredient she was allergic to.

headline.main: Pret A Manger Starts Labeling Food With Allergens
headline.print_headline: British Sandwich Chain Adds Allergens Warning

docs.abstract: A series of strategic shifts in the boardrooms and back rooms of the world’s biggest luxury groups — LVMH, Kering and Richemont — has been underway in recent months.
docs.snippet: A series of strategic shifts in the boardrooms and back rooms of the world’s biggest luxury groups — LVMH, Kering and Richemont — has been underway in recent months.
docs.lead_paragraph: On a sunny day earlier this month, scores of suited men and women found themselves in a  low-rise building on the outskirts of Florence, Italy, walking by bright hand-painted murals of birds of paradise, wildflowers and dreamy-eyed women wearing turbans, T-shirts and rhinestone-encrusted sunglasses.

headline.main: Luxury’s Chess Masters Prepare for a New Game
headline.print_headline: For Luxury Groups, a Shifting Landscape

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA

byline.original: By Elizabeth Paton and Vanessa Friedman

docs.abstract: A British labor group says technology has made work more intensive and led to longer days. Shorter working weeks have been tested, with mixed results.
docs.snippet: A British labor group says technology has made work more intensive and led to longer days. Shorter working weeks have been tested, with mixed results.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Increasing numbers of workplaces around the world are embracing technology, and a greater array of tasks is being automated. In the eyes of one major British labor organization, that need not be a threat to workers, but may instead offer an opportunity: less time working.

headline.main: In Britain, Calls for a 4-Day Week. Can It Be Done?
headline.print_headline: Someday, Every Weekend May Be Long

docs.abstract: The announcement definitively ends efforts by the Sinclair Broadcast Group to create a broadcast giant and potential rival to Rupert Murdoch’s Fox News.
docs.snippet: The announcement definitively ends efforts by the Sinclair Broadcast Group to create a broadcast giant and potential rival to Rupert Murdoch’s Fox News.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump cheered when Sinclair Broadcast Group, the nation’s largest operator of local TV stations and a leading voice for conservative views, made a $3.9 billion bid to buy Tribune Media. The consolidation would have created a company that could reach seven out of 10 American households.

headline.main: Tribune Ends Deal With Sinclair, Dashing Plan for Conservative TV Behemoth
headline.print_headline: Tribune Breaks Off Deal To Join Sinclair’s Stable

byline.original: By Edmund Lee and Amie Tsang
